entry.title: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase order by WBS code / storage location
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023  in a company that operates under a centralized purchasing model.

In SAP Business One, when creating a Purchase Order, if the items belong to different warehouses, the system automatically splits the PO into multiple purchase orders (one per warehouse). This is very useful for companies with centralized procurement but distributed warehouses/divisions, as it simplifies receiving and accounting at the warehouse level.

In SAP S/4HANA, I have observed that this functionality is not available by default. Instead, the system allows one PO to contain items for multiple plants/warehouses, and the logistics are handled separately.

ðŸ‘‰ My questions are:

  1. Is there a standard option/configuration in S/4HANA to achieve automatic PO split by warehouse/plant (similar to SAP Business One)?

  2. If not standard, what is the recommended best practice for centralized purchasing with bulk discounts and later distribution to different warehouses/divisions?

  3. Is the solution to use Stock Transport Orders (STO) or Central Procurement Hub after creating one bulk PO at the head office?

  4. Has anyone implemented a custom BAdI enhancement (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to mimic this B1 functionality in S/4HANA?

This is a critical requirement for us since our business negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers and then distributes materials to multiple warehouses.

Any guidance, best practices, or experience sharing will be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan RS

entry.title: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for patient billing
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement from our customer who are into medical device manufacturing. The product is shipped to various clinics and hospitals for handover to the patients who are prescribed by the doctor. After the use for prescribed time the device is returned to the company for download of patient data. The invoice is raised after the patient data is downloaded by the company and shared with the clinic, hospital, patient themselves for the services as per any contractual terms (services is the report which is based on data downloaded from the device).

The device is serialized and the same device is used multiple times for different patients after which it becomes non operational and is disposed in controlled environment. (Since the company is FDA regulated)

My question to experts is as follows if someone has come across a similar scenario on any other project.

1) What would be ideal sales process for the product being sent to the hospital or clinic? (Consignment process? - May be too cumbersome for multiple hospitals or clinics to manage in SAP)

2) Once the product is returned back to the company for patient data download what would be the right process to keep track of the device which needs to be then used for a different hospital or patient for reuse? Any suggestions?

3) How to link the billing of the services (report based on download of patient data) with the device and the patient since the device was shipped to hospital or clinic (not directly to patient).

Any suggestion or pointers to any SAP documentation would be appreciated and helpful to find a suitable solution for our customer.

Thanks,

Kartik Shah

entry.title: Tooling Decision for S/4 Transformation - Need input
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Hoping to tap into the collective wisdom of this community. We're just kicking off our S/4 transformation journey, and like many of you have probably experienced, we're navigating the maze of third-party tools.

Our focus right now is on custom code readiness. Our System Integrator has put forward SmartShift as their recommended solution for scanning our ABAP code. They're a known quantity, which is good.

However, I received what was likely a cold email from a company called Civra Research Labs. I checked out their site, and while it doesn't have the polish of a major vendor, I went through the demo of their AI-powered S/4 Readiness Scanner. Honestly, the tool itself looks pretty good and the AI-driven analysis does the job.

Here's the kicker: when comparing the proposed cost from our SI for SmartShift against Civra's pricing, SmartShift seems to be about 25 times more expensive. That's a huge difference.

So, I'm here to ask:

  1. Has anyone actually used tools from Civra Research Labs in a real project? I'm interested in their S/4 readiness, ABAP security scanner, or their Pen Testing Co-Pilot. What was your experience with the tool's quality, the results, and their support?

  2. On the other side, has anyone used SmartShift and felt the premium price was justified by the value delivered?

  3. Is a price difference this large a major red flag for the cheaper tool, or is it just a case of a newer player disrupting the market?

I'm looking for real-world, unbiased opinions to help us make an informed decision.

Appreciate any insights you can share.

(And a polite request: I'm looking for genuine user feedback, so no sales pitches or DMs from vendors, please.)

entry.title: Custom Report in Project System
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are planning costs on the WBS using unit cost method. The planned costs on a WBS is sum of planned costs for various item categories, obtained using simple multiplication of price and quantity. The costs will be planned in different versions. My client requires a report that compares the price, quantity, value of each item category in different versions for a particular WBS element or for the whole project (but WBS element wise). I am trying to prepare the functional specification of the report for ABAP development. CONSIDER A SITUATION WHERE BUDGET IS NOT PLANNED. I started by passing the project definition in PSPHI table of PRPS table and passing the WBS element in POSID field of the same table. I obtained OBJNR from this. I then passed OBJNR in RPSCO table along with the version in VERSN and obtained the details on planned costs with WRTTP for planned values. I am now unable to understand the link between RPSCO and CKHS table. If I pass OBJNR directly in CKHS, I am able to obtain KALNR. This KALNR is further passed in CKIS table to get the item category wise detail, i.e., price, quantity and value corresponding to each item category. Can you please guide me to establish a link between RPSCO and CKHS table? This link is necessary to pull the version in. If budget is planned, I can directly see BPGE table for VERSN and obtain KALNR and then pass KALNR in CKIS table to obtain the details at the level of item category. Will this still be the solution in cases of no budgets? Thanks

Edit: I have changed the language to English as suggested for better understanding but to my surprise now it's working!
I don't know what the problem was but I will drop the whole code here just in case.

The CDS:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'AlÄ±ÅŸ FaturalarÄ±'
